elements.description: Removed from v 6

elements.name: Age At First Conviction
elements.description: Age young person was first convicted of an offence (in years).

elements.name: Age At First Caution
elements.description: Age at first caution (in years).
elements.comments: Used to be 'Age at First Reprimand' but this was changed to Caution in 2014.

elements.name: Age At First Use
elements.description: The age of the Young Person when he/she first used the particular substance (in years).

elements.name: Alcohol Level Amount
elements.description: The amount of alcohol present in the blood, urine, or breath of the defendant.
elements.comments: Alcohol Level Amount should be used with Alcohol Level Method.

elements.name: Amount Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of monetary amounts that must be input with the result code e.g. a Fine would have an Amount Quantity of one.

elements.name: Arrest Summons Number
elements.description: To identify a particular defendant by their arrest/summons number (ASN), allocated by Police (or other prosecutor) when a defendant is arrested or summonsed.
values: Refer to CPR Defendant Or Offender

elements.name: Case Markers (Descriptive)
elements.description: A marker to highlight a characteristic of the case (relating to the person and/or the offence) as being of particular interest to CJO partners when handling the Case.
values: CO Crime Against An Older Person
SX Sexual offence victim (other than Rape - see RP)
elements.comments: These markers relate to the circumstances of the alleged offence and are to some extent a subjective characterisation of the offence.

elements.name: Case Markers (Procedural)
elements.description: A marker to highlight the procedural characteristic of the case (relating to the person and/or the offence) as being of particular interest to CJO partners when handling the case.
elements.comments: These markers represent a procedural or status ‘flag’ and may be used to guide workflow within the recipient organisation.

elements.name: Case Stage
elements.description: Current stage to which the case has progressed.

elements.name: CJS Offence Code
elements.description: A code to represent an offence (where offence is used in the generic sense covering the reasons for bringing a court case against a defendant).
elements.values: Must be a valid Offence Code on the PNLD-maintained Offence Codes Data Standard Database
elements.validation: AAYYNNN or COML NNN or XX00 NNN (all with an optional eighth character (A) to qualify an Offence Code as an offence of either attempting aiding and abetting conspiring or inciting to commit an offence).
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum.
elements.comments: Includes nationally based local offences (and byelaws). Local offences fit the pattern AAYYNNN (e.g. LO72NNN where LO72 refers to the local government act of 1972). Local variations of wording are not permitted.

elements.name: CJS Result Code
elements.description: A unique code representing a result.

elements.name: Closed Response 2
elements.description: A set of two fixed responses from which a respondent must choose; no other value for the response is allowed.
elements.comments: This choice of response is usually in answer to a closed ended question.

elements.name: Closed Response 4
elements.description: A set of four fixed responses from which a respondent must choose; no other value for the response is allowed.
elements.comments: This choice of response is usually in answer to a closed ended question.

elements.name: Complex Penalty Details
elements.description: Used for example where legislation dictates that maximum sentences vary according to the age of the defendant.
elements.values: The values are maintained within the PNLD Database.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.description: Removed from v 6

elements.name: Court Case Reference Number
elements.description: This is a unique reference number assigned to a new occurrence of a court case created on PNC.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. YY/CCCC/NNNNNND where YY - 2 digit year/CCCC - 4 digit Court Code (OU Third Level Legacy Code)/NNNNNN - Sequential Number D - Check character. Example - 05/9876/123456R. Number must be of valid format.
elements.comments: A mandatory data item for every Court Case (pending or otherwise).

elements.name: Court Type
elements.description: The type of court that made the adjudication.
elements.values: Please contact HMCTS Libra Standing Data management Team for a list of court types.

elements.name: Courts Max Custodial Sentence Length
elements.description: The maximum custodial sentence in ‘units’ that can be awarded for this offence in either a Crown Court or a Magistrates Court.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: See also the element Courts Max Custodial Sentence Unit.

elements.name: Courts Max Custodial Sentence Unit
elements.description: The unit of custodial sentence paired with Courts Max Custodial Sentence Length which determines actual length.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: See also the element Courts Max Custodial Sentence Length.

elements.name: CPR Defendant Or Offender
elements.description: The first Data Element within the Criminal Prosecution Reference (CPR) to identify the instance of a person or organisation as a Defendant or Offender in a case.
elements.values: Only applicable to FFFUUSS (refer to Organisation Unit Identifier for an explanation of FFUUUSS) YYFFFUUSSN(11)A e.g. 93105CE0101245932H.
elements.based_on: Existing Police Service Arrest/Summons Number (ASN) data standard
elements.comments: This Data Element is based on the format of the existing Police Service Arrest/Summons Number to identify a person or organisation charged or summonsed.

elements.name: CPR Offence Reason
elements.description: The second Data Element within the CPR. The Offence Code provides this Data Element.
elements.values: Must be a valid Offence Code on the PNLD-maintained Offence Codes Data Standard Database.
elements.comments: Refer to 'Offence Code' for details of length, validation and values.

elements.name: CPR Offence Reason Sequence
elements.description: The third Data Element within the Criminal Prosecution Reference (CPR), the sequence of an Offence Reason within a Defendant or Offender.
elements.validation: Numeric e.g. 001. This Data Element must be a three-digit number, with leading zeroes.
elements.based_on: Existing Police Service data standard ASN/Offence Code concatenation sequence.

elements.name: Criminal Records Office Number (CRO)
elements.description: To identify a particular person by their Criminal Records Office Number. The unique number assigned by the National Identification Service(NIS) or from late 1998 by National Automated Fingerprint Identification System (NAFIS) to identify the subject.
elements.validation: Up to 12 characters Either: NNNNNN/YYD or SF YY/NNNNNND.

elements.name: Current ETE Situation
elements.description: Describes his/her current ‘Education, Training and Employment’ situation.

elements.name: Custodial Indicator
elements.description: To indicate that the offence carries a custodial sentence i.e. that the Offender may be imprisoned for this offence.
elements.steward: Offence Subgroup of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: This is not mutually exclusive with the Fine Indicator.

elements.name: Date Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of dates that must be input with the result code (not including hearing dates).
elements.steward: Results Subgroup of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Defendant Present At Hearing
elements.description: To show whether the defendant was present at the hearing not present at the hearing or appeared by the presence of his/her barrister or solicitor.

elements.name: Disability Self Defined Code
elements.description: A code for the self-definition of disabilities.

elements.name: Disqualification Type Code
elements.description: To indicate the type (code) of driving disqualification that can be awarded for the offence.
elements.comments: Any offence can attract disqualification where the court decides to disqualify rather than impose a fine.

elements.name: Duration Length
elements.description: The quantity of [Duration Unit] awarded e.g. for two years imprisonment Duration Length = 2 and Duration Unit = Y (years).

elements.name: Duration Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of durations that must be input with the result code e.g. a suspended sentence would have three durations one for the length of sentence one for the supervision period and one for the operational period.

elements.name: Duration Unit
elements.description: The unit of Duration Length.

elements.name: England And Wales Indicator
elements.description: To show whether the CJS Result Code is outside the jurisdiction of the CJS.
elements.validation: Code is Alphabetic Literal is Alphabetic

elements.name: Ethnicity Observed 4 Plus 1 Code
elements.description: The Police 4+1 ETHNICITY code as used in the police identification.
elements.validation: Code is an integer value from 0 to 4 inclusive.

elements.name: Ethnicity Observed 6 Plus 1 Code
elements.description: The seven values (6+1) used in various Police applications to describe a person’s ethnic appearance to a third party.
values: 5 Chinese, Japanese or any other South East Asian

elements.name: Ethnicity Self Defined Code
elements.description: The code used to indicate the source of the definition. Self defined or observed. The ONS 16+1 ETHNICITY code as used in the census.
values: O9 Any other NS Not stated
elements.validation: Code is Alphanumeric Literal is Alphabetic.

elements.name: Ethnicity Self Defined Extra Definition
elements.description: Free text to further define the Ethnicity Self Defined value e.g. Kosovan Roma Scottish. Only to be used where a Ethnicity Self Defined value is present.

elements.name: Family Name
elements.description: The part of a person’s name used to describe family clan, tribal group or marital association (e.g. a surname).

elements.name: Features Of Harm Behaviour
elements.description: Nature of harmful behaviour.

elements.name: Fine Indicator
elements.description: To indicate that the offence type carries a fine.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.description: Removed from v 6
Removed from v 6
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Gender Type Code
elements.description: The code that represents a gender.
elements.comments: Further values including pre and post operative transsexual and transvestite may be added at a later date.

elements.name: Generic Date
elements.description: A generic data type for “Date” Data Elements.
elements.validation: Must be a valid date in the format CCYY-MM-DD.

elements.name: Generic Long Note
elements.description: A Generic Data Type for “Note” Data Elements.
elements.comments: Data Elements elsewhere within the DSC will refer to this entry for details of length and validation.

elements.name: Generic Short Note
elements.description: A Generic Data Type for “Note” Data Elements.
elements.comments: Data Elements elsewhere within the DSC will refer to this entry for details of length and validation.

elements.name: Generic Time
elements.description: Generic Data Type for elements where time is required.
elements.validation: Numeric. Must be in the format hhmmss.
elements.comments: Data Elements elsewhere within the DSC will refer to this entry for details of length and validation.

elements.name: Given Name
elements.description: The forename or given name of a person.

elements.name: Hearing Documentation Language
elements.description: An indicator to show whether the documentation for/from a court hearing is to be provided in both Welsh and English languages.

elements.name: Hearing Language Indicator
elements.description: An indicator to show whether the court hearing is to be held in the Welsh language.
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Home Office Classification
elements.description: The Home Office Stats Code to which the offence belongs.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. Three numerics followed by / followed by two numerics i.e. NNN/NN.

elements.description: Removed from v 6
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Language Requirement
elements.description: A free text field to provide notes about the defendant’s language needs, e.g. interpreter details.
elements.based_on: Language Needs Standard Prosecutor Interface v. 6.0
elements.comments: Version 4.3 of the DSC refers to a Language Requirement element in the Person structure.

elements.name: Legal Aid Status
elements.description: A code to describe the current status of an application for representation under legal aid.
values: FB Failed Both IOJ and Means
elements.comments: Agreed with Legal Aid Agency, May 2014.

elements.name: Legislation ID
elements.description: Act and section in full (not coded).
elements.values: A current list of legislation wordings is maintained by PNLD.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Likely Victims
elements.description: Identification of likely victim categories that the individual might offend against.

elements.name: Living With
elements.description: Identification of the individuals that the Young person has mostly living with over past six months.

elements.name: MAPPA Level
elements.description: Current most appropriate MAPPA level.
elements.comments: MAPPA support the assessment and management of the most serious sexual and violent offenders.

elements.name: Max Fine Crown Court
elements.description: The amount (of a sum of money expressed in sterling) of the maximum fine that can be awarded for this offence in a Crown Court.
elements.validation: A sign (+) followed by a maximum of 14 numeric characters.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: This allows for a minimum amount of +0.01 and a maximum amount of +999,999,999,999.99.

elements.name: Max Fine Mag Court
elements.description: The amount (of a sum of money expressed in sterling) of the maximum fine that can be awarded for this offence in a Magistrates’ Crown Court.
elements.validation: A sign (+) followed by a maximum of 14 numeric characters.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: This allows for a minimum amount of +0.01 and a maximum amount of +999,999,999,999.99.

elements.name: Max Fine Type Crown Court
elements.description: To indicate the maximum fine level for the offence when heard in the Crown Court.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Max Fine Type Mag Court
elements.description: To indicate the maximum fine level code for the offence when heard in the Magistrates’ Court.
values: 1 fine not exceeding level one on the legislative standard scale
2 fine not exceeding level two on the legislative standard scale
3 fine not exceeding level three on the legislative standard scale
4 fine not exceeding level four on the legislative standard scale
5 fine not exceeding level five on the legislative standard scale
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: The legislative standard scale is the scale of fine maxima, set by legislation.

elements.name: Max Penalty Points
elements.description: The maximum penalty points that can be awarded for this offence. Current range 2 to 12.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Min Penalty Points
elements.description: The minimum penalty points that can be awarded for this offence. Current range 2 to 12 and must be equal to or less than Max Penalty Points.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Mode Of Trial Reason
elements.description: The type/reason code for the trial.
values: 07 No mode of Trial - Either way offence
08 Offence triable only by court martial
09 Defendant chooses trial by court martial
10 Commanding Officer orders trial by court martial

elements.name: Name Change Sequence Number
elements.description: A sequence number coupled with an instance of Person Given Name and/or Person Family Name to provide the correct sequence of individual names within the person’s “full” name.

elements.name: No Fixed Abode
elements.description: Indicator identifying if a person has no fixed permanent place of residence or abode.

elements.name: NOMS Number
elements.description: To identify a particular person by their prisoner (or National Offender Management Service) number.
elements.validation: The current prisoner number is 6 characters, of three possible formats.

elements.name: Notes
elements.description: Miscellaneous notes that are not catered for in unstructured fields.

elements.name: Notifiable To Home Office Indicator
elements.description: To indicate that an Offence is required to be notified to the Home Office Government Department.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Number Of Previous Convictions
elements.description: Number of previous convictions.

elements.name: Number Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of number quantities that must be input with the result code.

elements.name: Occupation Code
elements.description: Identifies the code number relevant to the named occupation.
elements.values: Please contact the Chair of the DSF for the list of values.

elements.name: Offence Category Code
elements.description: The categories of offences. This covers criminal and non criminal court case/proceedings types.
values: EX Maintenance Enforcement of Foreign Account
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.based_on: Libra case types (as amended by CJSE Data Standards Forum)
elements.comments: It is possible that the category of offence may change during proceedings.

elements.name: Offence Date Code
elements.description: The code for the offence date to be used within the offence wording.
elements.validation: Code is Numeric. Literal is Alphabetic.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Offence Initiation Code
elements.description: Identifies the type of initiation by code.

elements.name: Offence National Region Code
elements.description: Code for a region to which the offence applies.
values: EWNI England, Wales and Northern Ireland
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.based_on: Refer to the PNLD-maintained Offence Codes Data Standard Database
elements.comments: The literals for each code are self explanatory.

elements.name: Offence Remand Status Code
elements.description: This specifies the remand/bail code status that accompanies the CJS Result Code.
values: S Remanded to youth detention accommodation
C Custody or remanded into custody
L Remanded into care of Local Authority
R Re-arrested after release on bail
P Conditional bail with pre-release conditions

elements.name: Offence Title
elements.description: The unique offence title i.e. a shortened version of the offence wording.
elements.values: PNLD-maintained. A current list can be provided by the data standards team.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.based_on: The truncated offence description in PNLD

elements.name: Offence Welsh Title
elements.description: The unique offence title in Welsh i.e. a shortened version of the Welsh offence wording.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.based_on: The truncated offence description in PNLD
elements.comments: Welsh Language versions of offence wordings are produced on an “as required” basis.

elements.description: Removed from v 6

elements.name: Organisation Name
elements.description: The name by which an organisation wishes to be known or the official name given to an organisation.
elements.comments: Only to be used where the role is Defendant/Offender.

elements.name: OU Bottom Level Name
elements.description: A name to represent the lowest level physical and/or logical organisation unit within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: Values will be within the managed content of the Organisation Unit Codes Data Structure.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.

elements.name: OU Code Bottom Level
elements.description: A code to represent the lowest physical and/or logical organisation unit within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
values: SS used by the Police Service
elements.validation: SS where: SS represents a bottom level organisation unit.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.
elements.based_on: Police Service Force/Station/System codes as used in the ASN

elements.name: OU Code Second Level
elements.description: A code to represent the highest physical and/or logical organisation unit level within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: This Data Element is the FF code only.
elements.validation: FF where: FF represents a top level organisation unit of a CJO.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.
elements.based_on: Police Service Force/Station/System codes as used in the ASN.

elements.name: OU Code Third Level
elements.description: A code to represent a middle level physical and/or logical organisation unit within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: Within the leading F - see Values above
elements.validation: UU where: UU represents a middle level organisation unit of a CJO subordinate to FF.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.
elements.based_on: Police Service Force/Station/System codes as used in the ASN.

elements.name: OU Code Top Level
elements.description: A code to represent a Criminal Justice Organisation or an external organisation which accesses the CJS Exchange.
values: This Data Element is the leading F code only
elements.validation: F where: F identifies a CJO.
elements.comments: Values J-Y at the leading F level are unallocated.

elements.name: OU Second Level Name Or Type
elements.description: A name to represent the highest level physical and/or logical organisation unit within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: Values are within the managed content of the Organisation Unit Codes Data Structure.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.

elements.name: OU Third Level Legacy Code
elements.description: A code to represent a physical and/or logical organisation unit at a level within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: Values are within the managed content of the Organisation Unit Codes Data Structure.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.

elements.name: OU Third Level Name
elements.description: A name to represent the middle level physical and/or logical organisation unit within a Criminal Justice Organisation.
elements.values: Values where available are within the managed content of the Organisation Unit Codes Data Structure.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.

elements.name: OU Top Level Name
elements.description: A name to represent a Criminal Justice Organisation or an external organisation which accesses the CJS Exchange.
elements.owner: The Owner is the individual CJO.
elements.steward: The steward is the individual CJO.

elements.name: Perceived Birth Year
elements.description: The perceived year in which a person was born, in the absence of Birth date information.

elements.name: Person Name Suffix
elements.description: A free text suffix added to a person’s name.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric, first character must be A-Z.

elements.name: Person Name Type
elements.description: A coded classification of the PERSON NAME.
elements.comments: If not present it is assumed that the Person Name Type is not Known/not recorded.

elements.name: Person Notes
elements.description: Miscellaneous additional information about the person (free text).

elements.name: Person Remand Status
elements.description: This specifies the remand/bail status of a Person in the role of a defendant/offender resulting from a court hearing.
values: PC Police and/or HM Customs Detention
elements.comments: Must only to be used where the Role = Defendant/Offender.

elements.name: Person Requested Name
elements.description: The name a person wishes to use which is different from the values in Title, Given name, Family Name and Name Suffix fields.
elements.comments: The Requested Name field should be used where a person requests a particular style of address.

elements.name: Person Stated Nationality
elements.description: Will assist courts with statistical returns and in the making of any recommendation for deportation.
elements.comments: Constrained values to conform to BSEN 3166.

elements.name: Person Title
elements.description: Form of address used to precede a person’s name.
elements.comments: A person can have multiple occurrences of a title.

elements.name: Plea Status Code
elements.description: The latest plea made by the defendant up to the end of the hearing being resulted in codified form.
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Police National Computer Id (PNC Id)
elements.description: To identify a particular person by the number allocated by police when creating a record on the PNC.

elements.name: Police Officer Rank
elements.description: A description of a police officer rank as maintained by ACPO.
elements.values: A current list will be provided by ACPO.

elements.name: Police Officer Rank Input Code
elements.description: An abbreviated form of a police officer rank as maintained by ACPO.
elements.values: A current list will be provided by ACPO.

elements.name: Police Officer Rank Numeric Code
elements.description: A numeric version of a police officer rank as maintained by ACPO.
elements.values: A current list will be provided by ACPO.

elements.name: Police Worker Collar Number
elements.description: To identify a particular person when that person is a police worker and has been allocated a collar number.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. Up to 7 characters (0-9 and A-Z).

elements.name: Police Worker Reference Number
elements.description: The reference, unique within an individual Police Force, that identifies the Police Worker within the Human Resources system.
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Pre-Charge Decision Indicator
elements.description: To show that the Case has been the subject of a pre-charge decision under the Statutory Charging programme.
elements.comments: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 shifts the responsibility for key charging decisions from the police to The CPS.

elements.name: Preferred Method Of Contact
elements.description: The Preferred Method of Contact for a Person.

elements.name: Pre-Trial Issues Unique Reference Number (PTI_URN)
elements.description: Identifies the Pre-Trial Issues Unique Reference Number (currently created by police systems).

elements.name: Pre-Trial Issues Unique Reference Number (PTI_URN) Suffix
elements.description: Identifies cases that have been split or merged by adding a suffix to the PTI_URN.
elements.comments: This is an extension of the Pre-Trial Issues Unique Reference Number.

elements.name: Previous Custodial Sentences
elements.description: Record of length of previous custodial sentences.

elements.name: Primary Index Offence
elements.description: A code to represent an offence where offence is used in the generic sense covering the reasons for bringing a court case against a defendant.
elements.minimum: See individual elements of OFFENCE_TYPE structure.
elements.maximum: See individual elements of OFFENCE_TYPE structure.
elements.comments: Contact YJB before using as this is under review.

elements.name: Reasons For Non-Attendance of Education Training or Employment (ETE)
elements.description: Non-attendance reasons - for education, training and employment.

elements.name: Recordable On PNC Indicator
elements.description: To indicate that an Offence is required to be recorded on PNC.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: Recordable offences in general relate to the more serious crimes.

elements.name: Religion
elements.description: A person’s religious faith.

elements.name: Result Applicable Qualifier Code
elements.description: Each result may have a number of qualifiers. Each qualifier provides further detail of a result.
elements.values: The Values for this standard are managed by the Results Subgroup of the Data Standards Forum.
elements.validation: Alphabetic, each qualifier is shown as 1 or 2 characters.

elements.name: Result
elements.description: The text description of a CJS Result Code.
elements.values: Refer to the table of CJS Result Qualifier Codes.

elements.name: Result Qualifier Code
elements.description: Each result may have a number of qualifiers. Each qualifier provides further detail of a result.
elements.values: The Values for this standard are managed by the Results Subgroup of the Data Standards Forum.
elements.validation: Alphabetic, each qualifier is shown as 1 or 2 characters.
elements.steward: Result Subgroup of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: Repeats. Note that result codes and qualifiers have a many-to-many relationship.

elements.name: Result Type Code
elements.description: Each result is deemed to be either Partial, Interim or Final.

elements.name: Risk Assessment Rating
elements.description: A generic risk assessment scale.
elements.comments: Provide context and guidance for interpretation of the values.

elements.name: Role Type Code
elements.description: The CJSE code associated with the type of role that an organisation or person may play within the criminal justice system.

elements.name: Security Remarks
elements.description: Free text to record any aspect of the security requirements of the subject.

elements.name: Seriousness Score
elements.description: Identifies the seriousness score assigned to an offence type.
elements.values: The set of Values is currently under review by the YJB.
elements.comments: Contact the YJB before using this Element.

elements.name: Sexual Orientation
elements.description: An individual’s orientation towards persons of the same sex, opposite sex, or both sexes.
elements.comments: This standard was developed in consultation with the NOMS Women and Equality Group.

elements.name: Specific Requirements
elements.description: Free text to record any aspect that CJOs and others should be aware of regarding the person.
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Standard Offence Wording
elements.description: The full wording of the offence as used in a charge against the defendant recorded on PNLD.
elements.values: Refer to the PNLD-maintained Offence Codes.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: In PNLD the variable data is identified as “**(..xxxxx..)” or “**[..xxxxx..]” where xxxxx is the value of the variable.

elements.name: Standard Statement Of Facts
elements.description: The full wording of the statement of facts with spaces for variables.
elements.values: Refer to the PNLD-maintained Offence Codes.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: In PNLD the variable data is identified as “**(..xxxxx..)” or “**[..xxxxx..]” where xxxxx is the value of the variable.

elements.name: Substance
elements.description: Descriptive name of possible substance used by an offender defendant.

elements.name: Summons Code
elements.description: Identifies the type of summons by code.
values: E Serious and Either Way Offences
M MC Act [section12 of the MC Act 1980]

elements.name: System Instance
elements.description: An optional three digit code that identifies a system instance within a CJS Area.
elements.comments: Specific examples not used due to security reasons.

elements.name: System Name
elements.description: A string which identifies the system type in plain English.
elements.values: Values are within the managed content of the System IDs Data Structure.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. CamelCase, no spaces, no punctuation.
elements.comments: Specific examples not used due to security reasons.

elements.name: Target Court Type
elements.description: The type of court within which a hearing should be held.
elements.validation: Alphabetic. Must be one of the two valid values.

elements.name: Telephone Type Code
elements.description: Free text to denote the type of telephone number.

elements.name: Text Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of text inserts that must be input with the result code.
Removed from v 6

elements.name: Time Quantity
elements.description: The quantity of times of day that must be input with the result code.

elements.name: Time Since Last Conviction
elements.description: This is a time specified in a result.

elements.name: Time Since Last Conviction
elements.description: This is a time specified in a result e.g. to report to a police station at a specific date and time (in years).

elements.name: UK Internal Country Code
elements.description: A unique code representing a constituent internal part of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. If Country Code value is GBR (United Kingdom), then one of the UK Internal Codes must be used.
elements.comments: The e-GIF Data Standards specify that if Country Code value is GBR (United Kingdom of Great Britain & N. Ireland), then a UK Internal Code is mandatory. A decision was made by the Data Standards team this would be made as optional within the Data Standards Catalogue.

elements.name: Usage
elements.description: Extent of defendant/offender use of a particular substance.

elements.name: Vehicle Code
elements.description: Identifies offences involving an LGV or PCV that are of interest to the Department for Transport.
values: L Large Goods Vehicle or Passenger carrying Vehicle

elements.name: Verdict Code
elements.description: The finding (decision) of the court.
values: A Not Guilty but Guilty of another offence

elements.name: Victim Type
elements.description: One or more of the following values: Specific targeted victim, Vulnerable victim, Repeat victim, Victim not known to offender, Racially motivated offence, Same gender as young person/offender.
values: Same ethnic group as young person

elements.name: Warrant Issue Date
elements.description: The last date for a party to comply with the terms of a direction.
elements.validation: Must be a valid date in the format CCYY-MM-DD. Where there is an accompanying start date, must be after the start date.

elements.description: Removed from v 6

elements.name: Welsh Legislation
elements.description: Welsh version of the act and section in full (not coded).
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum

elements.name: Welsh Offence Wording
elements.description: The full wording of the offence in Welsh as used in a charge against the defendant recorded on PNLD.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. In PNLD the variable data is identified as “**(..xxxxx..)” or “**[..xxxxx..]” where xxxxx is the value of the variable.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: Welsh Language versions of offence wordings etc are produced on an “as required” basis.

elements.name: Welsh Statement Of Facts
elements.description: The full Welsh wording of the statement of facts with spaces for variables.
elements.validation: Alphanumeric. In PNLD the variable data is identified as “**(..xxxxx..)” or “**[..xxxxx..]” where xxxxx is the value of the variable.
elements.steward: Standard Offence Wording Group of the Data Standards Forum
elements.comments: Welsh Language versions of offence wordings etc are produced on an “as required” basis.

elements.name: Youth Offending Team Unique Person Id
elements.description: Code which uniquely identifies a young person (YP). The code is locally allocated by the Youth Offending Team (YOT).
elements.validation: Youth_Offending_Team_ID part of code must relate to a valid identifier for a YOT.
elements.comments: Contact YJB before using as this is under YJB review.
